parameters: \n<Spirit>I must converse with this stranger first before I head forward
\n<Spirit>my name is Spirit, and I am on a spiritual journey right now
\n<Spirit>I am wondering as to what you are doing
\n<Spirit>and if you have the time to spare . . .
\n<Spirit>to be part of a book that I am writing
\n<???>also, you mention that your name is Spirit and you are on a
\n<???>oh, it just reminded me of my ethics teacher, he has a passion for
philosophy and you both have similar sounding names!
\n<Spirit>I hope I am able to meet him!
\n<???>but to get back on our conversation, I shall now introduce myself
\n<???>hello! my name is \C[9]Noel Christian T. Galinato
\n<Noel>I am a \C[9]First Year, B Fine Arts (Studi Arts), Block-B
\n<Noel>I prefer to be called by my nickname \C[9]Z-xian
\n<Z-xian>and disclaimer, I do not look like this in real life
\n<Z-xian>I just simply prefer drawing and presenting myself like this
\n<Z-xian>currently, I am just basking under the sun and getting some fresh
\n<Spirit>now, I would like to ask you about your \C[9]philosophy
\n<Spirit>I want to know about your life-well-lived
\n<Spirit>we shall base this the answers on \C[9]Leo Buscaglia's \C[1]views
\n<Spirit>he is an amazing existentialist psychologist who has brought great
\n<Spirit>I shall now ask you about your \C[9]Five Minimum Components of a Well-Lived
what would you like to question?
The Mechanism of Balance Between (#1) and (#2)
I have nothing left to ask . . .
\n<Spirit>I would like to know of your \C[9]Life Aspiration
\n<Z-xian>that is why I made this video game to submit
\n<Z-xian>I have already made a video game before
\n<Z-xian>I want to leave my mark on this planet as a video game developer
\n<Z-xian>I love video games, it has helped me grow as a person
\n<Z-xian>the unique stories that have I experienced, the characters,
\n<Z-xian>my life's meaning is to make games to allow other people to have
\n<Z-xian>video game development is an artwork in of itself
\n<Z-xian>and it is an artwork that I want to master
\n<Z-xian>my dream is to make a video game that will be able to touch the hearts
\n<Spirit>I have interviewed all kinds of people
\n<Spirit>from the people with the simplest jobs to the most complex
\n<Spirit>this is my first time interviewing a game developer
\n<Z-xian>well, I'm glad that I am the first gamedev you have interviewed!
\n<Spirit>tell me about your \C[9]Ceiling of One's Own Limitations
\n<Z-xian>oh, so basically the limitations of my life aspirations?
\n<Spirit>I simply want to know if you are aware of the limits of your abilities
\n<Z-xian>well as someone who is starting out game development
\n<Z-xian>I still have a lot to learn
I need a lot of time
I need to learn to make my own music
I need to learn to get better at drawing
\n<Z-xian>I have already self-reflected on these issues, sometimes I feel upset
\n<Z-xian>it makes me question about what point there is in continuing
\n<Z-xian>the first game I made took around 120 hours and the gameplay only
\n<Z-xian>managing my time while carrying schoolwork truly hinders my
progress and has taken a toll on my mental health
\n<Z-xian>I honestly wanted to give up multiple times and end my life
\n<Spirit>that is tiring, why would you do that to yourself
\n<Z-xian>when people gave me their reviews about my game, it made me happy
\n<Z-xian>a lot of people liked my game, it makes me want to improve ang get
\n<Z-xian>the ceilings that I have mentioned before, I belive that with
\n<Z-xian>I will be able to grow past it!
\n<Spirit>I never thought making games could be so hard
\n<Z-xian>even the game that we are in right now took a lot of time to finish
\n<Z-xian>this will be my second game that I have made
\n<Z-xian>despite this being tedious, I am having a lot of fun making it!
\n<Z-xian>I honsetly couldn't have done it without the help of my friends who are
The Mechanism of Balance Between (#1) and (#2)
\n<Spirit>I wonder about how you are able to balance all this, I want to know
\C[9]The Mechanism of Balance Between Life Aspirations and the Ceiling of
\n<Spirit>it simply means how you address your limitations
\n<Spirit>working on the contradictions between your essence and angst
\n<Spirit>how you are able to face and fight against the \C[9]Reality
\n<Spirit>you must contemplate on how to answer this
\n<Spirit>but do not fall too much on the contemplation lest you will experience
\n<Spirit>where all you do is contemplate and self-reflect without acting on it
\n<Z-xian>I have already done the self-refelcting some time ago
\n<Z-xian>and I am already currently workin on the mechanism of blance
\n<Z-xian>the simple solution that I have found is
\n<Z-xian>to simply work hard and manage your time
\n<Z-xian>the process of making music and making a game similar
\n<Z-xian>like in art, you will start off being bad
\n<Z-xian>but with time and effort, you will eventually be able to do it
\n<Z-xian>I am getting better at making video games
\n<Z-xian>my only trouble is mking music, I am still in the process of learning how
\n<Z-xian>that is how I address the mecahnism of balance
\n<Spirit>I am quite curious about your \C[9]Existential Rationlaization
\n<Z-xian>don't worry, I don't have any plans on ending my life
\n<Z-xian>the best way I can put it is \C[9]existence precedes essence
\n<Z-xian>I learned that during my ethics class
\n<Z-xian>I will never forget that particular discussion because of that quote
\n<Z-xian>I will continue to live my life despite things not going my way
\n<Z-xian>besides, life is too short to end it
\n<Z-xian>there are a near infinite amount of things that I can get into other
\n<Spirit>you should always continue living your life till the very end
\n<Spirit>one of the most important information I would like to know is about your
\n<Spirit>\C[9]“If you are to summarize your life into a maxim, then what is it?"
\n<Z-xian>well for my iconic principle, I would need to give context
\n<Z-xian>I just love how cool he is, even Alexander the Great is a fan of him
\n<Z-xian>when Alexander confronted Diogenes, he offered Diogenese anything
\n<Z-xian>it is a conversation between the richest man and the poorest man
\n<Z-xian>during their conversation, Diogenes was basking in the sun
\n<Z-xian>Diogenes took the request and said \C[9]"Do not darken me" \C[1]or something
\n<Z-xian>there was another interpretation of what Diogenes said  \C[9]“Move a little
to the right; you are blocking my sun.”
\n<Z-xian>his exact words on his language may be different due to
\n<Z-xian>but I personally belive the latter, because it gives room for a double
\n<Z-xian>where the "darken" could symbolize Alexander's offer of wealth and
how it can darken the soul
\n<Z-xian>after their interaction, Alexander said \C[9]"If I were not Alexander, then
I should wish to be Diogenes”
\n<Z-xian>to which Digenes responded \C[9]"If I were not Diogenes, I would still wish
\n<Z-xian>what truly amazed me is how he was able to humble the most powerful
\n<Z-xian>it made me question on which of the two is truly the most free
\n<Z-xian>the man who has everything or the man who has nothing?
\n<Z-xian>and because of that, I want to live life simply like Diogenes
\n<Z-xian>not to be darkened by money and power
\n<Z-xian>and for my self-realization principle is short and to the point
\n<Z-xian>from my experience, I just have to \C[9]"live my life"
\n<Z-xian>I've been living my life through trial and error
\n<Z-xian>a lot of hardships came by, I was trying to live my life to make people
\n<Z-xian>and because of that, I lost myself
\n<Z-xian>it was through philosophy that I was able to bring myself back
\n<Z-xian>my life-guiding principle is to have a simple life and to be yourself
I have nothing left to ask . . .
Wait, I forgot to ask something
Wait, I forgot to ask something
\n<Spirit>thank you for taking the time to answer my questions
\n<Z-xian>yeah, and its all thanks to philosophy and my ethics class
\n<Z-xian>I learned a lot during the discussions I had with sir
\n<Z-xian>it helped me be able to forgive myself
\n<Z-xian>the discussion with intent truly helped me
\n<Z-xian>I had a similar experience with sir, I lost a cat
\n<Z-xian>my cat would still be here if it wasn't for me
\n<Z-xian>I was still young and dumb at the time
\n<Z-xian>everytime the door opened, he always wants to leave
\n<Z-xian>one night, I let him out because I wanted to make my cat happy
\n<Z-xian>and in the morning, he was gone
\n<Z-xian>I felt truly guilty at the time and cried for hours
\n<Z-xian>its been years since it happened but the guilt never truly left
\n<Z-xian>it was until we had a discussion about how intent should be considered
\n<Z-xian>and since that day, I was able to realize that I can truly forgive myself
\n<Spirit>I see, I'm sorry for your loss . . .
\n<Spirit>now that the interview is over, we should wrap things up
\n<Spirit>what are you going to do now?
\n<Z-xian>then at noon, I'm going to eat lunch at a restaurant
\n<Z-xian>then afterwards I will continue to work on my video games
\n<Spirit>I see a person out in the distance
\n<Spirit>I wonder to what they are doing outside
\n<Spirit>I should approach and converse with them
\n<Spirit>maybe they have interesting stories to share
\n<Spirit>I can ask them of what their \C[9]Vsion of an Ethical Life\C[1] is!

\n<Spirit> I am a nomad who travels from town to town
\n<Spirit> to ask random people their philosophy
\n<Spirit> why the random persons you may ask
\n<Spirit> I like listening to people's stories
\n<Spirit> it is my dream to be a \C[9]storywriter!
\n<Spirit> and thus is the reason why I must travel
\n<Spirit> to immortalize the people that I have met
\n<Spirit> I also want to casually chat with people
